title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1:ADOLESCENTS LIVING WITH/AT RISK OF HIV

description.narrative: New ElementOutput 2.1: Adolescents living with or at risk of HIV have increased capacity to demand quality prevention, identification, care, and support services., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2:By the end of 2023, adolescents (10 to 19 years), particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive quality health, HIV, learning and protection services.

sector.narrative: Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents

Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New ElementOutput 2.1: Adolescents living with or at risk of HIV have increased capacity to demand quality prevention, identification, care, and support services.

description.narrative: UNICEF-supported interventions in the HIV sector adapted its approach to integrate COVID-19 in its programming. As such, UNICEF reached a total 5,871 (3,442F/ 2429M) adolescents and young people with information on sexual and reproductive health HIV and COVID-19 through peer-to-peer mentoring, civic participation and social accountability, 100% achievement of the initial annual target of 5,000. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of districts that are implementing at least 3 high impact adolescent prevention interventions
Number of adolescents reached with information on SRH/HIV
